Comment: As per [original article](https://lawandcrime.com/high-profile/trump-is-spitting-in-the-face-of-law-enforcement-president-pardons-lady-trump-for-spending-slain-officer-charity-funds-on-rent-cosmetic-procedures-and-her-daughters-weddin/) ðŸ“°:  - President Donald Trump has granted a â€œfull and unconditional pardonâ€ to Michele Fiore, the former Las Vegas councilwoman also known as â€œLady Trump,â€ who was convicted of â€œfleecingâ€ the community out of about $70,000 in a scheme to defraud donors to a charity for a police officer who was killed in the line of duty, using the money she collected for plastic surgeries, rent, and her daughterâ€™s wedding.  The pardon comes less than a week after U.S. District Court Judge Jennifer Dorsey rejected Fioreâ€™s attempt to overturn her conviction and grant her a new trial. The clemency was issued less than a month after Trump appointed Sigal Chattah, one of Fioreâ€™s close friends, as the interim U.S. Attorney for Nevada, The Nevada Independent reported.  Fiore, a former Republican gubernatorial candidate who was a justice of the peace when she was federally indicted on six counts of wire fraud and one count of conspiracy to commit wire fraud, was convicted on all seven charges following an eight-day trial in October 2024.  Jurors found that when Fiore was still a member of the city council, she solicited donations to build a statue honoring Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Officer Alyn Beck, who was killed while on the job on June 18, 2014. Her solicitations allegedly included a promise that â€œ100% of the contributionsâ€ would be put toward creating the statue.  While the statue does, in fact, stand in a flower bed near the entrance of Officer Alyn Beck Memorial Park in Las Vegas, it was raised without any financial assistance from Fiore. Instead, prosecutors said she converted all of the money she solicited from donors â€” more than $70,000 â€” to cash and money orders used â€œfor her own personal benefit.â€  â€œ[T]he jury heard from a veritable whoâ€™s who of Nevada business and politics, who wrote checks to Fioreâ€™s charitable organization or her political action committee in reliance on her promise that 100% of the donations would be used to fund the statue,â€ Dorsey wrote in the 77-page order denying Fiore a new trial. â€œBut the evidence showed that a development company paid for the statue, and not a dime of the money that Fiore raised was used for that purpose. Instead, each check was quickly converted to cash and spent on Fioreâ€™s personal expenses like rent, cosmetic procedures, and her daughterâ€™s wedding.â€  She was facing 20 years in prison on each charge and was scheduled to be sentenced next month.  But Fiore will now avoid prison as her attorney, Paola M. Armeni, filed a motion on Thursday to vacate her sentencing date â€œdue to executive grant of clemency.â€  A White House spokesperson told The Hill that Trump issued the pardon because Fiore was allegedly targeted for prosecution due to her â€œoutspoken conservative views.â€  â€œMichele Fiore, a former RNC Committeewoman and elected official from Nevada, made a name for herself through her outspoken and maverick personality,â€ the statement said. â€œA supporter of President Trump, she was also the first female Republican Majority Leader in the Nevada State Assembly.â€  But many others criticized the pardon as nothing more than a favor for one of Trumpâ€™s political sycophants.  â€œDonald Trump is spitting in the face of law enforcement. Again,â€ Democratic U.S. Senator from Nevada Catherine Cortez Masto wrote on X, formerly Twitter.  State Senate Majority Leader Nicole Cannizzaro, a Democrat from Las Vegas, shared a similar sentiment.  â€œMichele Fiore abused her position to defraud Nevadans and our law enforcement community,â€ the lawmaker wrote. â€œPardoning her solely as a reward for political loyalty is yet another embarrassing mockery of justice and the rule of law.â€  Nevada Attorney General Aaron D. Ford wrote: â€œTrumpâ€™s blatant disregard for law enforcement is sickening, and pardoning someone who stole from a police memorial fund is a disgrace.â€
